summary: An ordinance granting to the American Can Company, a corporation, its successors and assigns, the right to maintain and operate, until December 31, 1946, an overhead bridge for conveying goods, wares and merchandise across a portion of Alaskan Way, formerly known as Railroad Avenue, between Clay and Cedar Streets; specifying the conditions upon which such grant is made; and providing for the filing by said Company of an acceptance of such grant and a surety company bond.
